title: my hot take/suggestions
text: so i love the idea of threads. it‚Äôs a cool form of self expression especially since twitter became a ghost town (no one uses it anymore). but some things are already annoying me. firstly, having random verified people on my feed and i don‚Äôt care about them. i think we should have an option to see public thoughts and separate our followers. kinda like how ig has a favorite section on posting. secondly, i think it would be so cool if threads were built into the actual instagram app. similar to reels, we could also make threads a part of our profile. it could be a separate section like reels have that people can see our thoughts and get to know how we think. i think having a separate app is kinda extra. i love it but not a lot of people are actually interested in downloading another app, where as on the actual ig, like the new notes feature, people would engage more. other than that, i love this new addition!

title: "Sorry, something went wrong"
text: Been unable to post anything (or see feeds) in over 72 hours. I reported this several times, but as always with META, nobody will follow up on anything with you - or it will take weeks on end with no implications what-so-ever. And since you have no other way to contact any support (since support teams do not seem to exist at META) or report it to any misguided AI even, I remain stuck in limbo. Tried to log out and delete and reinstall, but nothing works. So I am basically rendered unable to use the app.

title: Leaves much to be desired..!
text: Threads is an interesting app with potential. It's sad how we can't add back the Threads badge to Instagram after removing it. We're also still missing basic features, such as the (1) tab to view only threads from those we follow, (2) ability to search up topics or we're interested in, and (3) privacy functions to hide those we follow and/or those that follow us. Other social media apps have these basic features! It'd be interesting to see more forum-like aspects incorporated on it. After all, forums and other discussion boards have Threads! I'm hoping topics will be organized and clearly presented (or easily found)..

title: It‚Äôs not easy to check follow backs.
text: This app is fire! It‚Äôs an incredible platform for democracy. If you‚Äôre a traitor, not so much. If you‚Äôre an insurrectionist you just get mass blocked. The community set the rules. You get no oxygen. Your hate get hidden, you get shared, and everyone blocks you. The only issue: it‚Äôs difficult to easily find out if a mutual follow has unfollowed you. This gives people the opportunity to build their following without having to deal with the 7500 follower limit. I‚Äôll never allow my numbers to go higher than 3k because it will get unmanageable.

title: shows promise
text: i‚Äôve been looking for a way out of twitter for a while because the platform has been turned into a worse place than it already was. but there‚Äôs no real alternative to twitter. until threads. it has the backing of Meta, it doesn‚Äôt have a ‚Äúbuy verification here‚Äù button, and the oligarchical billionaire that controls it mostly keeps to himself. the platform is still in its early stages and is missing many vital features you‚Äôd usually see in a social media platform, but i have hope for the future. sadly for NSFW creators, they‚Äôre stuck on twitter.

title: A breath of fresh air
text: I signed up for Twitter just before Hurricane Sandy. At the time, I lived in NJ. I was without power for 14 days after the storm. I was able to refresh my phone and follow the election results. It became my got to source for breaking news .. until Elon Musk. The trolls and MAGA made it impossible to remain. I‚Äôm just an regular person, the trolling of celebrities and politicians was abhorrent and terrifying. I‚Äôm thrilled to be on Threads. I tried all of the other alternatives before Threads which were full of pornography. Threads is just a breath of fresh air.

title: still extremely underbaked
text: i got threads the first day it launched and now (october 20th, 2023) it feels exactly the same as it did at launch, which isn‚Äôt good. there are barely any features, the algorithm for showing you new threads is absolutely awful and never seems to make up it‚Äôs mind on what it thinks you want to see. there‚Äôs no DM feature built-in, no trending topics page, no real way to search for certain posts, photos, hashtags or anything! threads as it is now, is essentially an echo chamber of unfunny meme accounts, onlyfans ads, and branded content like starbucks and brands like those. even the ‚Äúmute‚Äù function barely works, as i keep seeing my muted accounts pop back up on my feed. if you want threads to be great, we‚Äôre gonna need more than this.

title: Love it!
text:
I don‚Äôt understand the hate on the app. They‚Äôre slowly weekly/bi-weekly introducing updates and features that we‚Äôre used to on other social medias. I love how engaging the platform is! Transferring over was seamless with already having an Instagram account + being able to follow people you already follow on Instagram just makes it a very smooth transition! I‚Äôd say give the app a chance. It‚Äôs new and a baby in the industry, but so far, free of controversy and the vibes overall, are just immaculate!
It‚Äôs like one big party on here!

title: pretty decent. has potential!
text: as the tittle says, pretty decent & has potential! but personally, as i‚Äôm sure others would agree too (i also know you‚Äôre still developing/tweaking) but i would love my home feed/timeline to consist of ONLY the people i follow. i‚Äôd like a separate explore tab with all the random ppl (the home page you currently have) would be nice! i would love to pick & choose when i get to see random people i don‚Äôt follow because my home page just feels like spam/junk mail with zero access to content i actually care about.  also, would love to see a, who i‚Äôm following tab as well. thanks!

title: Great app, more to be added though
text:
This app is great - very user friendly, simple, fun to use and post things. Personally, I think it should incorporate more things from instagram 1) so it can further distinguish itself from that *one* social media platform
and
2) it can be a more complex, yet, again, simple to understand interface
Some things I‚Äôm talking about is maybe a ‚Äúdrafts‚Äù option, maybe another version of ‚Äúclose friends‚Äù where only a select few can view your post. Just things like that, but overall, amazing app!

title: Great start!
text:
More features are requested, for sure, including the ability to filter posts (or threads, I should say), perhaps the ability to quickly switch between accounts (especially if you have more than one), and maybe the ability to send private messages (or rather, DMs), just to name a few.

But overall, it‚Äôs a nice, clean app, easy-to-use, and hopefully will live up to be the ‚Äúkiller app‚Äù that everyone is expecting it to be (you know, compared to that other one with the blue bird)!

title: It's aight
text:
It's a new app so I'll give it some slack but whenever I go into my feed, it shows random people posting. Which isnt a problem, I couldn't care less but I'd prefer to see people I've followed first just like the actual Instagram. 

Leads me into my next point, I can't seem to comment or post threads. It's literally the main purpose of this app too. I've tried uninstalling it and redownloading it and refreshing my feed. Nothing works, it just keeps kicking me out everytime I try to post something. Could be something I'm only experiencing, and it's not that big of a deal because I don't post much anyways. 

Overall, its still a new app so I'm hoping these bugs will get fixed soon.

title: After reading reviews and ‚Ä¶
text:
I‚Äôve been on Facebook and Instagram since their conceptions so I decided to Wu‚Äôs on setting up a Threads account especially after reading the first dozen reviews. After the 2016 presidential election with all the misinformation peddled by Facebook I stepped back from any Mark Z. Apps. I don‚Äôt see him as a true humanitarian but rather self enriching like the fake president with the same self enrichment evils he helped get elected. Z has set America back decades in mho as I‚Äôve never seen so much hate and sheer ignorance in society today than in the 12 potus‚Äôs I‚Äôve lived through to date. Sorry Z but I don‚Äôt trust you. 

With that said, I won‚Äôt be adding Threads to  my now limited Facebook and Instagram usage.

title: No search, really
text: I got on Threads quickly, but then didn‚Äôt return until a few weeks later. I wanted to see what people were saying about a particular news story, so I hit the search icon and typed in the surname of the person in the news. All I got was a bunch of Threads users I could follow ‚Äî no search of posts. There‚Äôs seemingly no way to do that. Since I used Twitter mainly for news and now need to rebuild my feed (can‚Äôt access my old Following list anymore), this app is unfortunately pretty useless to me without a search that will help me find the content I‚Äôm looking for. Oh well, maybe in the future.

title: Needs improvement
text:
For something called Threads, the conversations are terribly threaded. Threading replies are placed indented under their parent comment so that the individual branches of a conversation are easy to follow. Even Facebook does this with comments. The Threads layout is hard to follow. Too many sub-pages and poor indicators of who was talking to who.

The second issue is the feed. My feed is all rando-people talking about trending topics that the algorithm decided to show me. If it decides to show me something from a person I actually DO follow, their post is buried down in the feed. The feed needs to be separated into ‚Äúpeople I follow‚Äù and ‚Äúsuggested‚Äù.

title: It‚Äôs just too liberal
text: I try to stay away from politics, it just ruins everything.  It seems every liberal has joined this app and all they do is spread hate and misinformation.  Yet nothing gets flagged or taken down.  However I see conservative posts flagged and taken down constantly.  I just feel like apps like this get ruined by taking a certain political side, regardless if it‚Äôs left or right.  This app has taken a complete turn for the left and is completely unapologetic about it.  It would be just as poisonous if it took a turn for the right.  I get that media and tech is sort of a left wing thing so I get the decision to go that way, but it‚Äôs a bad decision and unless you are very liberal this app is literally quite pointless.

title: Pretty amazing
text: I love that it connects to your instagram. The app works amazing for being new. Zero errors. That‚Äôs great. However, I want to bring up the bad more than the good. Things I don‚Äôt like is seeing people I follow respond to other threads. That should be a feature one can turn off.  I just want a clean timeline of threads I follow. Also I think there should be an option to search for threads easily. For example, I would like to search threads on puppies. Right now I don‚Äôt really see an option like that.

title: Better than others but not great
text:
First impressions were that Threads was a much nicer experience than other social media platforms however as time went on (24 hours) my feed started to become inundated with crypto scams, nudity and racist content. Expecting this to be dealt with, I flagged to the content moderation team only to be told that this sort of thing (hard R, crypto scams) were not against the rules and would not be removed. 
If this is the policy then I‚Äôm afraid the site will quickly become just as toxic as the others. Such a shame as it has such potential. I wish them all the best but if there is no rule against hate speech, nudity or scams, it‚Äôs not something I want to be a part of.

title: Day Two on Threads
text: So, I tried to log back into Threads with my Instagram account for the second day just now, and I have been receiving an error message that would tell me to ‚Äúplease wait a few minutes‚Äù before I try again. I believe that it must have something to do with me logging in so many times with my Instagram account every time I opened the app yesterday. With that said, I was wondering if you‚Äôll add a feature on there that would allow me to remain signed in to Threads without me having to log in with my Instagram account every time I open the app? Please let me know and fix this issue ASAP.üôèüèª

title: Too many text limitations for a text-based app
text:
- Needs to remove timer to edit your post/reply (currently, you get 5 mins after posting to edit. So, if you see a mistake later or you change your mind about the attachment, you have to delete and repost entire entry. Time and emotional draining if you‚Äôre a content creator. Honestly, just ended up typing in a different app and copy/paste into Threads which defeats the purpose of Threads being a text-based app).

- Needs an option to turn off auto-play for videos  

- Needs a Mature Content option to censor for users to check before posting (The posts can‚Äôt tell between genuine fashion models/figure art and those stupid sexbots/scammers‚Ä¶ like what is security anyway?)

title: its so silly goofy
text: Hey bbg, 5 stars. However, please make switching between more than one account a thing (so i can have my public and private threads) and make a follower and following list there so i can easily sort through who i want to follow and who i dont. Also, not sure if this is just a me problem, but i have to confirm follow requests even though my account is public. I'm assuming thats a bug and its VERY annoying because that means a lot of my followers cant see what i post. ty for reading my review <3

title: better than twitter but still not great
text:
i love the vibes and the atmosphere and how it‚Äôs like if twitter and tumblr had a baby. BUT. they need to work on it. why is my feed just a bunch of random people that i have no interest in? why are there no filters for what you see in your main feed? why is there not an option to only look at the people you‚Äôre following? why does it not show me when the people i follow post something?

these are such basic features for a social media app to have, and you‚Äôd think instagram (and facebook) of all platforms would know the bare minimum of what to add to a twitter-like app.

title: Great, but for the PornBots
text: Many many people, like myself, have found an engaging respectful community from the beginning with this app. In fact, I might have given it a 4-star rating. But now, the pornbots have taken over and has made this app nearly impossible to enjoy. I have reported approximately 100 accounts. About  10% have been closed and the offending accounts removed. All the others say "received" with no action taken and a few have reported back that the account was not removed, SorryCharlie. It's clear these are bots as many have the same profile pics/bios. I have chosen to make my account private until this issue is resolved. I will definitely leave Threads if it is not.

title: If Instagram and Twitter had a horrible baby
text:
Its like all the worst parts of both platforms, all in one app. The only feed you get is algorithm based, so you end up seeing a bunch of people you don‚Äôt know and don‚Äôt care about. I spent so long blocking people just to get passed all the corporate accounts and celebs. Instagram has a similar algorithm and its a big reason why I rarely use it. 
There‚Äôs no TAGS. You can look up specific users and that‚Äôs it. No way of finding other people, it‚Äôs just whatever the algorithm feeds you- which will be mostly blue checks trying to get in your good graces so you buy their crap or whatever. Everyone is posting about how great the app is, but it feels so fake. Like are they even using the same app?

title: Another Meta owned app
text: Yet ANOTHER app by Meta in an attempt to be the only folks who run social media, which wouldn‚Äôt be so bad if they actually did it well. Reach on ALL their platforms has gone so incredibly downhill that I‚Äôm ready to ditch social media entirely for my business and get creative doing my own thing. They treat all artists like their UNPAID content creators and even if you are just starting out and have a small following they limit your reach of your posts don‚Äôt perform to their standards. It‚Äôs like being in high school all over again. I hate being bullied into posting what they want and when they want and how they want or else no one will see my posts ever. I‚Äôm so ready for something better and not owned by Meta.

title: A Twitter knockoff that is missing features
text:
I like to use new apps simply for technical curiosity. Since this is meant as a Twitter competitor, my comparisons are going to based on its features

Pros: Signup was a snap since it directly took my information from Facebook and Instagram. 

Cons: There are obvious missing features that Twitter has:
1 There is no institutional integration with other sites to direct users to Thread feed
2 No direct messaging 
3 No way to organize Thread followings to given topics (e.g. sports Threads in a feed)
4. The feed puts topics that would not appeal to me. Why didn‚Äôt include this knowledge from FB/IG?
5. No integration with FB/IG
6. No way to remove suggested Threads from feeds. 
7. No way to taylor ads to my desires
8. Nothing new or innovative compared to Twitter, Parler, et al.
9. None of my Followers on FB/IG directly transferred to Threads. 

Bottom line this is a me-too Twitter app, that I question would be its value proposition long term. If one really desires this type of social app, just sign up to Twitter.

title: Privacy Concerns and Disappointing User Experience
text: Treads app, touted as a social media aggregator, falls short of expectations due to significant privacy concerns and a lackluster user experience. The app demands the deletion of your Instagram account alongside deactivating your Treads account, citing the need to extract all data from Instagram, which they blame on TikTok. This questionable data handling practice raises serious privacy concerns and leaves users in the dark about how their personal information is being used. Moreover, the app's cluttered interface, poor integration, and frequent technical issues undermine its usability and convenience, making Treads more of a hindrance than a reliable social media tool. Proceed with caution and prioritize your privacy when considering the use of Treads.

title: I like Threads but‚Ä¶
text: I like this app a lot. There‚Äôs no stupid rules and toxic people like Twitter. The only thing I would like changed is when you are scrolling on your feed and you‚Äôre seeing people‚Äôs posts it would be nice to see posts from people you follow. I don‚Äôt mind seeing posts from people I don‚Äôt follow but I‚Äôd like to see majority of the posts on my feed from people I follow. I was recently scrolling on my Threads feed and 90% of the posts were from people I do not follow. I would like to see posts from people I follow. Other than that the app is great.

title: Why Do We Need This
text:
Meta and the Zuckerberg ownership have already reduced Instagram to an impossible place for a worldwide membership of photographers to freely post their work and to like the work of the followers they have worked years to establish. 

Instagram is not the place it was for the visual arts and so many people have left or stopped posting.  Please reconsider your algorithms so we don‚Äôt go six months without viewing the work of people we admire. 

As to Threads - why?  I talk to so many people who don‚Äôt understand the reason for this or the concept other than drawing away interest in Instagram, which is a marquee name among photographers. 

Please give those who now have to work days instead of hours on Instagram a loosening of these restrictions.  There should be a separate set of standards for business accounts. 

Every time I see an Instagram update, I know how much harder I have to work to have a photograph seen by half the viewership I had a year or two years ago. 

These views are shared by a large audience of photographers I speak with on your changes.

title: Sewing Club
text:
When I signed up; a little late, I was still so nicely welcomed and encouraged to share my thoughts in a whole new light. Threads has shown me and my friends that creativity, kindness and compassion ARE indeed still strong and out there in the world!

Thanks to Mark & the Meta team for finally giving us a platform that has the potential of making new standards for humanity as a whole to connect and share our experiences & ideas!
Can‚Äôt wait for what‚Äôs to come moving forward.

title: I don‚Äôt think this will last long
text:
I don‚Äôt understand the point of this app.

So let me get this straight: Zuckerberg wanted to create a text based app that could compete with Twitter. But‚Ä¶we still have Facebook?? Facebook has gone down in relevancy over the years but it still has millions of users that log on everyday. Despite Twitter becoming more political and more catering to men, I think it‚Äôs far more entertaining to be on there than on Threads. Threads is just so boring and i think everyone had low expectations for it from the start. And yes, I know Twitter is X now, but I‚Äôm still calling it Twitter.

title: Twitter, I mean ‚ÄúX‚Äù alternative
text: It‚Äôs a good start.  I‚Äôm hoping that it will eventually show threads in bleacher report like twitter used to‚Ä¶Twitter to me is pretty useless now after stopping that! This would be a major upgrade to threads!!! Also, and this is big, I don‚Äôt want to have instagram in order to have threads! It‚Äôs the one thing that I will give Facebook credit for. I liked being able to have messenger and not Facebook itself.  Hopefully they will separate threads from instagram and can be a separate entity like messenger is (or was) from Facebook‚Ä¶haven‚Äôt had Facebook in a long time so I don‚Äôt know how it is now!

title: Why does it have to be linked to Instagram?
text:
Since Elon Musk has ruined Twitter forever, I wanted to use an alternative (Threads for now). However, I‚Äôm skeptical about linking my instagram account to create an account on Threads. The audience on instagram are different than the ones on Threads, the way I‚Äôd use both apps are also different. Not to mention, that I use pseudonym on instagram and it‚Äôs a private, while Twitter before (now Threads) isn‚Äôt. 
The other thing, I have had Twitter for 10+ years, I have created a base, I wish we had an option were we merge the followers from Twitter to Threads, I know this is not the case.

title: Please add the switch accounts button!!
text:
Good app so far!! I don‚Äôt use Twitter but since I‚Äôm joining this app right as it‚Äôs getting started I have time to figure this system out! It‚Äôs very clean and simple, which I enjoy. 

Please Meta, please add the switch accounts button so we don‚Äôt have to log out between accounts. It would be so much better!! Another feature that would be nice is filtered feed like in Instagram where you can switch between following and recommended. Thanks!

title: Cute! But needs more features
text:
Threads is a really aesthetically pleasing alternative to twitter although it does need to have a messaging feature and also a pinned thread feature. As well as a feature that allows us to see the image posts that a user has created to help promote artists, photographers, and cosplayers or any kind of content creator really.
I love the interface, it's very cute. Also the fact I can open this app in public without the risk of seeing weird fetish porn or cats being microwaved(stuff you'd see on twitter) is very refreshing.

title: Search/Trending/NotInterested Needed!!!
text: The algorithm is good. Things that I like and people that I know show up on my timeline, but I want to SEARCH things. What are people saying about (random topic)? I wouldn‚Äôt know cause Threads doesn‚Äôt have that option. I want to see the TRENDING topics of discussion. Big moment happening, so what are people saying? I wouldn‚Äôt know because Threads doesn‚Äôt have that option. I want to click ‚ÄúNOT INTERESTED‚Äù on something. Makes sense because the timeline is algorithm based, right? Well, Threads doesn‚Äôt have that option either. Fix these issues, and I swear Threads could take down Twitter. GET ON IT.

title: Threads locked me out of my account with zero notice or explanation
text:
After using threads for a week or two, my account suddenly stopped working.   It is still public.  Others can see it.  I cannot post but I also cannot take down posts.  I cannot deactivate my account.  It‚Äôs just frozen in time.  

I‚Äôve wondered if perhaps threads thinks I‚Äôm abroad, because I did travel.  But I am back home in NY and was here when this started.   

It‚Äôs much more frustrating than if the account had been entirely shut down, because I keep getting notifications that people have written or replies or followed etc, but when I click on the app I cannot see them.  And I cannot post anything to explain it to people.

title: Why make it political?
text:
Threads had the opportunity to be a friendly alternative to Twitter/X that helps us move away from constant political banter and helped restore the original idea of a lighthearted conversation based platform. 

Unfortunately the algorithm has gone ‚Äúfar left‚Äù and today when I went to check my feed all I could find was either 1. Anti Israel 2. Anti moderate political view 3. Irrational far left conspiracy theory being pushed by the algorithm.

I‚Äôm not saying it has to be overtly right leaning or even display my moderate conservative views in the algorithm‚Ä¶ I think we‚Äôd all just prefer a place without dumb political banter being pushed by the algorithm.

title: What is the point?
text: What is the actual point of this app? It has no way of really connecting with new people or content as a stand alone platform. If we can really only connect with people we already follow or follow us on IG‚Ä¶what is the point? We can already see what each of us post on there. Now it‚Äôs just repetitive. I add tags to my posts on threads hoping one day they will work. And maybe work with others around the world that we also want to tag. I hate Twitter and find it super toxic. I was hoping for a great alternative‚Ä¶ this sadly isn‚Äôt it. Bring us the ability to tag and I will come back and revise my rating. Otherwise, it‚Äôs a useless app taking up space on our devices. ü´§

title: Random accounts and suggestions
text:
It‚Äôs only day 3 and I‚Äôm already exhausted from scrolling through a feed of random verified accounts that I‚Äôve never shown interest in or interacted with. I was really hoping that this app would allow me to view content and posts that I actually wanted to see, rather than copying every other social media and constantly forcing me to view videos and posts from accounts I‚Äôm not concerned with. 

If there is one thing social media needs, it‚Äôs the ability to truly see only what you follow. There are enough ads and suggested posts based on data sharing as it is. Please remove the feature that allows any and every account access to your feed

title: So fun
text: This app is so fun and it‚Äôs like twitter except for kids and more popular. I think threads should have a feature where you can switch between accounts instead of having to log out of the account that you are already on so you can go on a different account. You should really get this app and it‚Äôs so fun being some of the first 10,000,000 users on this app because everyone is just so lost and you can also see your favorite creators join.

title: Decent
text: Needs a suggestions tab of ‚Äúpeople you might know‚Äù if you didn‚Äôt click the follow all option in the beginning. tired of seeing random peoples posts. also wish the name option in your bio didn‚Äôt transfer over and you can put a different name on the threads app. Following tab for others? liked posts / #‚Äôs / trending searches / explore? But still make it stand out from twitter. Know that‚Äôs already on the instagram app but it‚Äôd be cool to have something different on threads to scroll through

title: Initial thoughts
text: This is a new platform by Meta, it may seem like a Twitter ripoff, and it is. It‚Äôs a direct competitor to the famous bird app and it a nice addition to Instagram and the Meta family in general. One thing that I really like is regardless of using your instagram account for threads, you can choose to have your Threads profile public while keeping your Instagram account private. Again, this is a new platform and my thoughts on this could change for the better or worse over time.

title: How beautiful am I?
text: Just another place to post meaningless photos of scammers. Narcissistic poses and dilute life. When you look at yourself in the mirror your looking at the beauty of life‚Ä¶not a special little you.  Only life can become beautiful.  Be driven inside by God not Self

userName: please let me delete the badge

text: I downloaded it to see what it would be like but none of my friends posted so I deactivated my account as I couldn‚Äôt figure out how to delete it.  But the stupid ‚Äú100M‚Äù or whatever the threads badge is keeps popping up on my profile every time I move from any other page on Instagram to my profile. title: Absolutely and completely shady
text: This app is trying to track even MORE of my data than ever before? And the only way to make it stop is to completely delete you Instagram??? You won‚Äôt tell us WHY you need this extra data or continuous tracking EVEN AFTER the app is deleted (seems like a violation of Apples developer terms imo), nor are you making it easy for people to opt out of the app and it‚Äôs services. And the fact that the UK won‚Äôt allow this up in the App Store in their region for these very reasons are more than reason enough to not download.  If I‚Äôm completely misinformed or wrong, please do tell, otherwise you guys need to seriously change what this app does exactly

title: Pretty awesome. One feature I‚Äôd like though
text:
I want the option to post multiple threads as a carousel on instagram.

For example, if I have 10 or less threads all replying to each other I want to hit one button to post all of them as pictures onto instagram without posting each one individually (I could post each message individually on Twitter if I wanted to take the time.) I think that feature would be really cool on threads and encourage more engagement.

Maybe we could increase the carousel limit on ig too?

title: Missing features and a minor bug... but overall good
text:
It works as it's supposed to, but there is a bug or something that's slowing down the loading of one's own replies. That might be due to the influx of users, but it's still something that's a little bit annoying.

There's also no way to search for specific words or find trending topics, which is a huge feature this app is lacking that is severely needed. Hopefully this is something that will be added in the very near future.

title: Absolute trash. Don‚Äôt waste your time.
text:
I would give this app 0 Stars if possible.

I absolutely hate thirst traps. Detest them with all I am. After blocking so many accounts on Instagram, I finally had wholesome content. Then I see this. To see what it‚Äôs all about and either confirm or deny what my assumptions were, I downloaded Threads. Immediately the first thing I‚Äôm hit with is a thirst trap. This app is no better than Instagram. I‚Äôm not going to sit around blocking people. 

What‚Äôs worse if even after blocking one account, I STILL got that same account in my feed showing me more garbage I don‚Äôt want to see. This is trash and I won‚Äôt ever consider it again. Don‚Äôt waste your time on this garbage.

title: Unable to access
text: I'm a US resident, but I was in Europe when Threads launched. it seems to have marked me as an EU resident and it's keeping me from accessing my profile, notifications, and content Despite my Instagram account having an ad account with a US phone number and address as proof. I have three Instagram accounts (business, personal, and niche hobby) with none of the linked Thread accounts accessible. I've cleared the cache, deleted and reinstalled the app, deleted the app, restarted my phone, and then reinstalled. Nothing works. I've tried contacting IG support, but I know from past experience that they won't get back to me, so maybe a review of the app will. Believe me, I'd rather be on that than on Twitter.
